item.title: Dan add a quote by Scott Donaldson
item.description: "As Henry Dan Piper, one of Fitzgerald's most perceptive critics, has commented, his fiction heroes "are destroyed because they attempt to fulfill themselves through their social relationships. They cannot distinguish between social values like popularity, charm, and success, and the more lasting moral values." Their creator did make that distinction, however, and so was constantly surrounding his characters with a mist of admiration and then blowing it away." -- Scott Donaldson

item.title: Dan add a quote by William Saroyan
item.description: "Their singing wasnâ€™t particularly good, but the feeling with which they sang was not bad at all." -- William Saroyan

item.title: Dan add a quote by Walker Percy
item.description: "The self has no sign of itself... For me, certain signifiers fit you, and not others. For me, all signifiers fit me, one as well as another. I am rascal, hero, craven, brave, treacherous, loyal, at once the secret hero and asshole of the Cosmos." -- Walker Percy
